qas.question: When was oil discovered in the city limits?
What routes used Oklahoma City as a major route change?

context: Before World War II, Oklahoma City developed major stockyards, attracting jobs and revenue formerly in Chicago and Omaha, Nebraska. With the <a0_0>1928<a0_0/> discovery of oil within the city limits (including under the State Capitol), Oklahoma City became a major center of oil production. Post-war growth accompanied the construction of the Interstate Highway System, which made Oklahoma City a major interchange as the convergence of <a1_0>I-35, I-40 and I-44<a1_0/>. It was also aided by federal development of Tinker Air Force Base.
